Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s first entry into that particular camp called ‘Night Of The Living Dead’ spawned nine additional movies, as well as several popular theatrical sequels by other filmmakers. With popularity apparent, studios wanted in on this zombie gold rush.
With time comes genius imitators

After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie, like going to the theater and watching one. Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was pale by comparison to My Life as a Zucchini.
My Life as a Zucchini  won best-animated picture at the Oscars this year with one of most moving scenarios you will ever see.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless action film. In Canada stopping for fuel, Joe goes to the Palace Petula beauty pageant final. There, he meets Miss Anchorage and love ensues.
